description:
Tree works subject to Tree Preservation Order (No.163) 1997:

False Acacia (T1):  Fell and replace.
Lime (T2):  Crown thin by 20%, crown reduce by 10%, Removal of dead, dying and crossing branches.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION:  Under Section 206(1) of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) there is a duty to replant a tree to replace the removed tree.  In this case the replacement tree should be planted as follows:
The Council requires that a 'Small leaved Lime' Tilia Cordata to be planted as a Standard  tree with a girth of 14-16cms.  The ground should be prepared to the standards set out in BS5236:1975.  The tree should be suitably staked and tied.  The replacement should be planted in position marked 'X' on the attached plan by next planting season not exceeding the end of the current planting season (March 2004).

REASON:  In order to comply with the provisions of Section 206 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended), ensuring that a satisfactory visual amenity is provided on site.
